title: Local ski resorts giddy over weekend flakes - Local
text:
Some folks may have grumbled over the snowflakes that fell across New England over the weekend, but ski resorts were downright giddy.
Check out the following enthusiastic tweets posted from the mountains.
Related Link Get today’s headlines right in your inbox
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Sunday River in Maine, which opens today, tweeted this on Sunday:
Ready to go. The season starts tomorrow. #happyplacefound pic.twitter.com/77fl3PJcz7
— Sunday River (@sundayriver) October 18, 2015 And this:
Double fist pump. Both arms. That's legit. pic.twitter.com/XRLT7vxkhW
— Sunday River (@sundayriver) October 18, 2015 Killington in Vermont, which opened Sunday, tweeted this:
First open in North America! It sure feels good to be back on snow. #beastwinter pic.twitter.com/WnSljkFvJy
— Killington Resort (@KillingtonMtn) October 18, 2015 And this:
October 18, 2015. A fine day. #beastwinter #beast365 pic.twitter.com/oy3T2YMxtq
— Killington Resort (@KillingtonMtn) October 18, 2015 Sugarloaf in Maine couldn’t resist posting the following:
Currently serving 100% natural snowflakes, straight from Mother Nature herself. #theloaf #firstsnow #winteriscoming pic.twitter.com/AxFwv5ejXl
— Sugarloaf Mountain (@SugarloafMaine) October 17, 2015 From Vermont’s Jay Peak:
One more fit before sundown. #jaycloud pic.twitter.com/awdnf4xnNI
— Jay Peak (@jaypeakresort) October 19, 2015 From Waterville Valley in New Hampshire:
First flurry of the year! Winter is here! pic.twitter.com/L722unShc4
— Waterville Valley (@waterville) October 17, 2015 And, finally, from Bromley in Vermont:
#snow today! #winteriscoming #lovewinter pic.twitter.com/Q493mTG9u1
— Bromley Mountain (@BromleyMountain) October 18, 2015 Extreme skiing in New Hampshire :
